instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 not powering up
threads.message:
There is no sign of spillage on the unit. When lid opened or power button pressed only charging icon shows on screen, current goes to 2.1a then back to 20ma. When left on charge it just stays at 40ma and does not charge the battery or power up.
Is there a boardview or schematic for this?

Any ideas appreciated

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 not powering up
threads.message:
Nothing available for this model.

Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 not powering up
threads.message: I cant seem to get it to go into SMC bypass

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 not powering up
threads.message: Just in case, try to put it in DFU restore mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 not powering up
threads.message:
Sorry but how do I do that

?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 not powering up
threads.message:
Search the forum, detailed information available.
Different threads with usefull information available.

[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/search/14879/?q=dfu+restore&o=date[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 not powering up
threads.message: Thanks for your help. I got it somewhat working except now it gets to Activation screen and wont go into command +r mode, just straight to internet recovery and previous owner does not know the unlock details. I cant boot from external USB on it also.
